post.author: Zasz
post.title: GWT code splitting best practice is not really best practice
post.content:
I believe if you put in code like

 

GWT.runAsync(new RunAsyncCallback(){

@Override

public void onFailure(){

} 

@Override

public void onSuccess(){

}  

}); 

 then what happens is that the onSuccess code is actually going to be in the file that gets downloaded. And the onFailure code , together with the code downloading code is in the initial/current javascript file.

 As the GWT compiler tries to compile the SourceUnit (souce file) that contains this code, it will put 

 

 

Sorry -----------------------=Am gonna complete this later!=--------------------------- GTG
